source_note: State baseline derived from Wisconsin DNR Recycling Program; local collection rules may vary by municipality.

organics.guidance: Composting and organics diversion encouraged under DNR Solid Waste rules; food waste programs expanding in major cities.
organics.bin: Green/organics bin or compost drop-off site.
organics.notes: Madison and Milwaukee have food scrap and yard waste programs.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper, cardboard, and cartons; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue recycling bin or local drop-off.
paper_cardboard.notes: No waxed, wet, or greasy cardboard.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or glass drop-off site.
glass_containers.notes: No window glass, ceramics, or drinking glasses.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle clean aluminum and steel/tin cans.
metal_containers.notes: No scrap metal or pressurized containers.

plastics.guidance: Recycle plastic bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1–#7; local programs vary.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: No statewide deposit or refund law in Wisconsin.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle with curbside or drop-off program.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries through HHW or retail collection.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of trash and curbside bins.
provenance: Wisconsin DNR HHW and battery recycling

e_waste.guidance: State law bans landfilling of electronics; use E-Cycle Wisconsin registered recyclers.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, computers, monitors, and printers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted in curbside recycling.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return to retail store collection bins.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items require scheduled pickup or landfill delivery.
bulky_items.notes: Fees and disposal rules vary by municipality.
provenance: City of Madison bulky item collection
